Iran News: Eye on Iran

Iran news is distributed daily through UANI’s newsletter, Eye on Iran, to make it easier for subscribers to be fully informed on developments in the Islamic Republic.  Eye on Iran, with archives dating to 2009, provides insights on all the Iran news you need to know.  Subjects covered in this daily round-up range from Iran’s nuclear and ballistic missile programs, regime dynamics, and Iranian regional and global ambitions to Iranian human rights abuses and sponsorship of terrorism.

Founder Of Iranian Company Accused Of Sanctions Violations Pleads Guilty

An Iranian businessman accused of conducting financial transactions that violated U.S. sanctions has pleaded guilty, the U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday. Seyed Sajjad Shahidian, founder and former chief executive of Iranian online financial services company Payment24, in May pleaded not guilty in federal court in Minnesota after being arrested and extradited from the U.K., according to court documents. Mr. Shahidian, in a videoconference Tuesday, changed his plea for one count of conspiracy to defraud and commit offenses against the U.S.

Link Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-huawei-iran-probe-exclusive/exclusive-huawei-hid-business-operation-in-iran-after-reuters-reported-links-to-cfo-idUSKBN23A19B to the article on The Wall Street Journal.
